title: The ultimate daily social media checklist to keep you on track
text:
The ultimate daily social media checklist to keep you on track Use your key for the next article Copy and paste this checklist to use daily. Meagan Hope 
Let’s face it, social media marketing is time consuming. Wouldn’t it be great if there were a weekly and daily checklist you could follow? Look no further, here is a weekly and daily checklist for Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, and Pinterest. You’ll find it easier and more strategic to do weekly planning and scheduling, which takes about 4-5 hours per week to create. Each day it takes about 1-2 hours to finish your daily checklist. If that seems like too much time, consider hiring a part-time social media manager or a content writer. 
Feel free to copy and paste this checklist and use it daily. 
Facebook 
Strategic Weekly Planning: 
· Schedule content 7 days ahead and post every Monday. (Make sure content is written well, encourages engagement, evokes an emotion within 2 seconds, and make sure 1 out of every 3 posts has a strong call-to-action. Don’t sounds “Salesly” people don’t want to be sold on something on Facebook). 
· Create graphics for the week. 
· Create video for the week. 
· Tag people and businesses in posts when needed (1-2x per week) 
· Share 1-2 posts per week from another FB page that your audience would like to see. 
Daily To-Do Items: 
· Check daily for updates, messages, and comments then respond to comments within 24 hours or less. 
· Comment on 3 FB pages (example: neighboring business, industry leader, a like-minded business). 
· Like 3-6 new pages a day. 
· Share a great customer experience daily. 
· If you are running Facebook ads, make sure to check daily and adjust when necessary. 
Twitter 
Strategic Weekly Planning: 
· Schedule content 7 days ahead and schedule posts every Monday. Use Hootsuite to schedule posts and monitor your Twitter page. 
· Create at least 3-5 graphics to accompany your Twitter posts per week. 
· Find great articles to post to Twitter per week and also link to your website 1-3x per week. 
· Tag people and businesses in Tweets when it makes sense (1-2x per week) 
Daily To-Do Items: 
· Check daily for mentions, direct messages, and retweets then respond within 24 hours or less. 
· Engage with people that are on your lists on Twitter daily by liking, retweeting, and responding to their posts. 
· Follow 50 -75 like-minded business, people, and others 2-4x per week. 
· Share a great customer experience daily. 
· Learn what are the best times to post on Twitter. 
· If you are running Twitter ads, make sure to check daily and adjust when necessary. 
Instagram 
Strategic Weekly Planning: 
· Schedule content 7 days ahead and schedule out every Monday. Use Hootsuite to schedule posts and monitor your Instagram page. (New feature as of August 2015) 
· Create 2-3 graphics/short videos for daily use on Instagram. 
· Tag people and businesses in posts when it makes sense (1-2x per week) 
· If you sell a product consider using a platform like Soldsie to post 1-5 items per day that link directly to your item on your online store. There are other great programs to use to sell here . 
Daily To-Do Items: 
· Check daily for comments, direct messages, reposts, and hashtags that you use, then respond within 24 hours or less. 
· Follow 50 -75 like-minded businesses, people, and others 2-4x per week. 
· Learn what are the best times to post on Instagram . 
· Like 10-15 pics within your feed and search hashtags that are relevant to your brand. 
· Comment on 5 pics per day within your feed. 
LinkedIn 
Strategic Weekly Planning: 
· Schedule content 7 days ahead and post every Monday. Use Hootsuite to schedule LinkedIn posts. (Make sure content is written well, encourages engagement, and evokes an emotion within 2 seconds). 
· Create graphics for the week. 
· Create video for the week. 
· Find like-minded articles from influencers to share throughout the week. You can also schedule these within LinkedIn. 
· Schedule posts on LinkedIn as the hour is coming to and end and usually posts do best in the morning hours on LinkedIn. 
· Publish an article on LinkedIn at least 1x per month. 
· Recommend someone 1x per week. 
Daily To-Do Items: 
· Check daily for updates, messages, and comments then respond within 24 hours or less. 
· Comment within 2-3 groups daily. 
· Like, comment, or share up to 5 posts daily made from someone in your home feed. 
· Find at least one new connection daily. 
· If you are running LinkedIn ads, make sure to check daily and adjust when necessary. 
Pinterest 
Strategic Weekly Planning: 
· Create or plan for 2-3 graphics/short videos that you want to post to Pinterest that will link back to your website. 
· If you sell a product consider using a platform like Pinterest . 
Daily To-Do Items: 
· Check daily for comments, direct messages, and repins then respond within 24 hours or less. 
· Follow 50 -75 like-minded businesses, people, and others 2-4x per week. 
· Learn what are the best times to post on Pinterest. 
· Like 10-15 pics within your feed and search keywords that are relevant to your brand. 
· Make sure your boards are using popular keywords on Pinterest. 
· Repin 10-20 pins daily 
· Pin at least 2-3 pics from your website, blog, or write-ups about your service or product daily. 
· If you are running Pinterest ads, make sure to check daily and adjust when necessary. 
One last thing, it’s a good idea to keep an Excel document that keeps track of the people and businesses you reach out to daily on your social media pages. When you repost, comment, or like a new page, make sure you’re documenting that. 
Good luck and happy planning and posting!
